page.title: 02Holy Trinity CEP School
page.content: The village school is housed in a modern building which was purpose built in 1966. This building replaced the old school which is now a house. The school has three classrooms, two of which are in the main building and one is a mobile classroom. There is also a hall, offices and a kitchen where the school lunch is prepared. The children begin school in the term in which they become 5 years old and leave in the July after they become ll years old. They transfer to secondary schools in Horsham - Forest School for the boys and Millais for the girls. The school is surrounded by its own playing fields and two asphalt playgrounds, where athletics, football netball, rounders, basketball and other games take place.
